text.headline: Timelapse Summarizing What Happened In The Health Care Since 2020
text.text: Board Meeting.

text.headline: Enloe's clinic programs restored after ransomware incident | KRCR
text.text: CHICO, CALIF. — The Enloe Medical Center is close to the fully-functional restoration of its core system after a ransomware incident which affected its network after its discovery two weeks ago on January 2. https://krcrtv.com/news/deprecated-butte-county/enloes-clinic-programs-restored-after-ransomware-incident

text.headline: Regina Leader Post
text.text: The Saskatchewan NDP is raising concerns about the government’s handling of eHealth Saskatchewan after a ransomware attack hit the organization’s servers on Sunday. EHealth says no personal medical information has been compromised, and clinical services are not being disrupted. https://leaderpost.com/news/local-news/ehealth-saskatchewan-hit-by-ransomware-attack-but-private-records-not-compromised

text.headline: Ransomware Attack on Brandywine Urology
text.text: Ransomware Attack on Brandywine Urology Impacts 131K. Patients Brandywine Urology Consultants in Delaware is investigating a January ransomware attack; a business associate incident, phishing, an email hack, and another ransomware event complete this week’s breach roundup. https://healthitsecurity.com/news/ransomware-attack-on-brandywine-urology-impacts-131k-patients

text.headline: Maze Ransomware Hits Healthcare
text.text: Maze Ransomware Continues to Hit Healthcare Units amid Coronavirus (COVID-19) Outbreak: The infamous Maze Team has struck again, this time infecting an urgent walk-in care center in Texas with its system-crippling ransomware. https://securityboulevard.com/2020/03/maze-ransomware-continues-to-hit-healthcare-units-amid-coronavirus-covid-19-outbreak/

text.headline: Affordacare Patient Data Allegedly Published Online - Infosecurity Magazine
text.text: An American healthcare provider whose patients' records were allegedly published online in a ransomware attack has told patients their data is secure.  Affordacare runs an urgent care walk-in clinic network out of five locations in Texas. The organization was hit by a ransomware attack in February. https://www.infosecurity-magazine.com/news/alleged-affordacare-patient-data/

text.headline: Ransomware Attack on Brandywine Urology
text.text: Ransomware Attack on Brandywine Urology Impacts 131K Patients Brandywine Urology Consultants in Delaware is investigating a January ransomware attack; a business associate incident, phishing, an email hack, and another ransomware event complete this week’s breach roundup. https://healthitsecurity.com/news/ransomware-attack-on-brandywine-urology-impacts-131k-patients

text.headline: New York Health System Back Online Following Ransomware Shutdown
text.text: Rochester, N.Y.-based Jordan Health is back online after shutting down its entire network Feb. 27 due to a ransomware attack, according to local NBC affiliate WHEC.  Officials continue to work to retrieve files on two servers for administrative staff. https://www.beckershospitalreview.com/cybersecurity/new-york-health-system-back-online-following-ransomware-shutdown.html

text.headline: Ransomware Attack on Public Health District Website
text.text: The Champaign-Urbana (Ill.) Public Health District’s website was encrypted in a ransomware attack March 10, according to The News-Gazette.  To spread the most updated information on the coronavirus, health officials are urging the public to visit the district’s Facebook page. https://www.beckershospitalreview.com/cybersecurity/illinois-public-health-website-shut-down-in-ransomware-attack.html

text.headline: Mysterious Cyberattack Cripples Czech Hospital Amid COVID-19 Outbreak – HOTforSecurity
text.text: A cyberattack hits the second-biggest hospital in Czech Republic in the midst of the Coronavirus outbreak last Friday. The incident was confirmed by the Czech National Office for Cyber and Information Security , which is working alongside police and hospital staff to recover from the damages and secure their network. https://hotforsecurity.bitdefender.com/blog/mysterious-cyberattack-cripples-czech-hospital-amid-covid-19-outbreak-22566.html

text.headline: Hackers Access PHI
text.text: Hackers Access PHI During Mat-Su Surgical Ransomware Attack Arkansas-based Mat-Su Surgical is notifying 13,146 patients that a hacker accessed their PHI during a ransomware attack in March; a website configuration error and another ransomware attack complete this week’s breach roundup. https://healthitsecurity.com/news/hackers-access-phi-during-mat-su-surgical-ransomware-attack

text.headline: Hackers Access PHI
text.text: Hackers Access PHI During Mat-Su Surgical Ransomware Attack Arkansas-based Mat-Su Surgical is notifying 13,146 patients that a hacker accessed their PHI during a ransomware attack in March; a website configuration error and another ransomware attack complete this week’s breach roundup. https://healthitsecurity.com/news/hackers-access-phi-during-mat-su-surgical-ransomware-attack

text.headline: Moorestown VNA Hit With Ransomware Attack - NJBIZ
text.text: Moorestown Visiting Nurse Association was hit with a ransomware attack, potentially exposing patients’ private information.  Data host Crossroads Technologies informed Moorestown VNA of the incident on March 19 after conducting an investigation that found its patient database was likely accessible by the ransomware attacker. https://njbiz.com/moorestown-vna-hit-ransomware-attack/

text.headline: 'Double Extortion' Ransomware Attacks Spike | Threatpost
text.text: More ransomware operators are setting up pages where they threaten to publish compromised data from victims – an added pressure for victims to pay the ransom. Research experts warn that “double extortion” attacks will continue to hit ransomware victims in 2020 – particularly with more hospitals, which not only collect sensitive, health-related data, but are also currently on the front lines of the coronavirus pandemic being targeted with cyberattacks.

text.headline: RDH Suffers Ransomware Attack | Rio Blanco Herald Times | Serving Meeker, Rangely, Dinosaur & Northwest Colorado
text.text: Software used by the hospital to access some database records entered between August 2012 and August 2017 was infected by ransomware, causing loss of access. https://www.theheraldtimes.com/rdh-suffers-ransomware-attack/rangely/

text.headline: Florida Orthopaedic Institute victim of a Ransomware Attack
text.text: Florida Orthopaedic Institute (“FOI”) discovered a data security incident that may have involved the personal information of our patients. We sent notification directly to the potentially impacted individuals to notify them of this incident and provide resources to assist in protecting their personal information. https://www.thecentersquare.com/florida/florida-lawsuit-offers-glimpse-into-estimated-1-4b-ransomware-toll-on-u-s-businesses/article_18904a64-c097-11ea-b307-c7486c456a7f.html

text.headline: U.S. Concerned by Threat of Cyber Attack Against Czech Republic Healthcare | Reuters
text.text: The United States is concerned by the threat of a cyber attack against the Czech Republic’s healthcare sector, U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo said on Friday, adding that anybody engaged in such activity should “expect consequences.” https://www.reuters.com/article/us-czech-cyber-usa/u-s-says-concerned-by-threat-of-cyber-attack-against-czech-republic-healthcare-idUSKBN22000J

text.headline: Colorado Hospital Patient Information System Hit by Crypto Ransomware
text.text: Colorado Hospital Patient Information System Hit by Crypto Ransomware Hackers have infected the infrastructure of Parkview Medical Center with ransomware that demands cryptocurrency in exchange for an encryption key. https://cointelegraph.com/news/colorado-hospital-patient-information-system-hit-by-crypto-ransomware

text.headline: Europe’s Largest Private Hospital Operator Fresenius Hit by Ransomware
text.text: Europe’s Largest Private Hospital Operator Fresenius Hit by Ransomware Fresenius, Europe’s largest private hospital operator and a major provider of dialysis products and services that are in such high demand thanks to the COVID-19 pandemic, has been hit in a ransomware cyber attack on its technology systems. The company said the incident has limited some of its operations, but that patient care continues. https://krebsonsecurity.com/2020/05/europes-largest-private-hospital-operator-fresenius-hit-by-ransomware/

text.headline: Maze Ransomware Group Hacks Plastic Surgeons PII
text.text: Maze Ransomware Group Hacks Two Plastic Surgeons Ransomware leaks social security numbers and other sensitive information from plastic surgery studios. https://cointelegraph.com/news/maze-ransomware-group-hacks-two-plastic-surgeons; https://www.beckershospitalreview.com/cybersecurity/ransomware-attackers-hit-2-providers-post-patient-information-and-photos-online-5-details.html
